column4: i'm running Ubuntu 11.10 and I just got a new router but I can't seem to connect to it consistently. I've run several commands and the output can be seen here: http://paste.ubuntu.com/1040384/.
On failures, I seem to be getting a 'Reason 2' error in dmesg which seems to mean 'Previous authentications no longer valid'
you mean your "wifi" and your AP(access point).
well i don't think there's anything wrong with my laptop's wifi or my AP, I dual boot win7 and it connects without a problem everytime
nope, but the gateway is set to 192.168.1.254
um.. so what about pinging to .254 then?
that works, i get a response
oh it does.. then what "does" not work?
maybe you mean the dns isnt working?
it takes a long time to connect to a wifi network, today, 3 and a half minutes
what does the wired ethernet get as it's ip?
when I look at the output from dmesg, i see a 'Reason 2' error right before it connects to the same network
the wired shouldn't get a similar ip in the same subnet (eg: it shouldnt get an ip from the same AP router)
i'm not connected via cable, i only connect via wifi
